summary: looking at the new pics for season 8 had me thinking... can you imagine jaime being present at some jon&sansa interactions and...
question: looking at the new pics for season 8 had me thinking... can you imagine jaime being present at some jon&sansa interactions and having this "oh boy" look on his face because he /knows/ that feeling and then mentioning it to jon like "it's alright, you know.  these feelings you have for her" 😢😢
answer:
I can totally see that Anon! Jamie looking at Jon with that “look” that says he’s familiar with these Jonsa interactions, with Jon looking at him like he was crazy, but he’s slowly realizing his feelings for Sansa all the same.

I feel like either Jamie might say something to Sansa or Jon about their feelings for one another, all too familiar with the feelings of forbidden love between “siblings”

summary: So I’ve been rewatching the last season and it dawned on me that Sandor had cleaned up before the meeting in KL. Do you think...
body: So I’ve been rewatching the last season and it dawned on me that Sandor had cleaned up before the meeting in KL. Do you think it’s possible that Jon was informed that Sansa was invited to KL and word got to Clegane that his sister will be in KL (not knowing Sansa had sent Brienne in her place.) At first I didn’t think it was significant. However I realized that he never cared about how he looked while working for the Lannister’s so why now? I couldn’t see him giving a damn about looking good for the royals. Why clean up the beard, brush the hair and sporting clean clothes? I like to think he did it in hopes of looking presentable for Sansa.

I like to think he did it in hopes of looking presentable for Sansa.

At first I didn’t think it was significant. However I realized that he never cared about how he looked while working for the Lannister’s so why now? I couldn’t see him giving a damn about looking good for the royals. Why clean up the beard, brush the hair and sporting clean clothes? I like to think he did it in hopes of looking presentable for Sansa.

summary:
So the question was "why aren't people weirded out by Jon and Sansa relationship?,"
I guess that last line Kelsey stated is my...
body:
So the question was “why aren’t people weirded out by Jon and Sansa relationship?,”

I guess that last line Kelsey stated is my exact point from that Jonsa/JaeSanne post I did a few months back.

It’s an interesting point she made in that last paragraph. If Jon will accept his Targaryen side, then it makes sense that his Genes could drive him to pick Sansa as a potential partner considering in F&B most Targaryen brothers were still attracted to their sisters even when growing up with them (so no Westermark effect here people).

summary:
@fortunatelylori replied to your post “im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon...”
              ...
body:
@fortunatelylori replied to your post “im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon…”

I’ve always thought of Sansa as the moon and Arya as the sun in Ned’s quote. I didn’t even think people imagined them the other way around.

Most people assume on the first read/first look that Sansa is the sun and Arya’s the moon. Sansa’s bright and vivacious — she’s described as radiant and she has traditional skills of a Lady. Arya’s wild and moody — she’s looks like she could be the moon to Sansa’s sun. That’s how the trope fits aesthetically; Sansa’s red hair and Arya’s brunette. And while both girls fit the sun and the moon attributes in their own way, so one can argue that it’s somewhat interchangeable, it’s more likely that Sansa’s the moon and Arya’s the sun, yes. It’s not the most obvious thing, I’ve noticed, since in a lot of the Stark Sisters edits, Sansa represents the sun and Arya the moon.

summary:
❝Kill all monsters❞

  Theon knows what Ramsay has done to Sansa, but also Sansa knows what Ramsay has done to Theon. They’re...
body:
❝Kill all monsters❞

Theon knows what Ramsay has done to Sansa, but also Sansa knows what Ramsay has done to Theon. They’re not going to touch each other without having mutual consent.

“I don’t want to touch you” he murmurs looking at her, “I don’t want to touch you if you don’t want it too” he looks down, afraid of memories.

“I don’t want to touch you either” she whispers looking back at him, “I don’t want to touch you either, if you don’t want it too” she looks down too, afraid of memories.

Sansa guides Theon’s hands on her body, and Theon guides Sansa’s hands on his body. They both burst into tears after few instants.

They’re crying because no one has ever touched them with such a gentleness, slowness, sweetness, as if they fear to break each other again. It’s in this way that Theon dares to touch Sansa, and it’s in this way that Sansa dares to touch Theon.

They know each other’s monsters: they’re going to destroy every trace of them through kisses and caresses. They’re going to kill them all. Together. 

——  Sansa x Theon aesthetic |  © caption by me.

summary: Another awful theory I have seen was that Sansa was going to sacrifice her life so Danielle and her Boatie could live as payment...
body: Another awful theory I have seen was that Sansa was going to sacrifice her life so Danielle and her Boatie could live as payment for Caitlyn  “abusing” Jon and her being “mean” to him. Um even if Caitlyn did abuse Jon why would her daughter have to pay the consequence of her mothers actions. Also Sansa wasn’t mean to Jon there is no evidence to even suggest she was. Jon only ever thinks of her in a positive light. How she taught him to talk to girls and singing. She never even called him a bastard to his face like Robb did because she knew it would hurt his feeling. Stop acting like Sansa needs to sacrifice herself for your favorite pyro because of some missed placed blame for Jon’s pain.

ned: *coming in with his shotgun* tough day-

cat: ned, what the hell was all that screaming?

ned: oh that? i panicked and shot sansa-

cat: oh my God

ned: sansa’s dog. cat, you gotta let me finish my sentences. anyway, she chased off the deer we were hunting so today was a disappointment

summary: Something else I was thinking about were the stone statues in the crypts. When Arya and Sansa reunite they meet in the crypts...
body:
Something else I was thinking about were the stone statues in the crypts. When Arya and Sansa reunite they meet in the crypts and talk about their fathers and how it should have been carved by someone who knew his face but everyone who knew his face was dead.

People keep theorizing that the statues of Sansa and Arya are young because they die young while Jon’s is old because well, he lives. However I disagree. I think Sansa purposefully had these built while they’re all alive because she wants them to be done by someone who knows them. I think Jon’s looks old because of the facial hair. It makes it harder to carve but it still looks like Jon. The statues are never that flattering.

But that’s just my thoughts.

tags: source: beef fried rice no spicy
summary:
Sansa: But you can't fall for Ramsay's trap like an idiot.
Jon: I am an idiot. 
Sansa: Well, that's good to know.
